accessibility.text: Besides inlining values, unquoting has a second essential function: inlining meta-reactive objects as code
Besides inlining values, unquoting has a second essential function: inlining meta-reactive objects as code
> downloads <- metaReactive({\u2028+   cranlogs::cran_downloads(!!input$package,\u2028+     from = Sys.Date() - 365, to = Sys.Date())\u2028+ })
Besides inlining values, unquoting has a second essential function: inlining meta-reactive objects as code
> downloads <- metaReactive({\u2028+   cranlogs::cran_downloads(!!input$package,\u2028+     from = Sys.Date() - 365, to = Sys.Date())\u2028+ })
> downloads_rolling <- metaReactive({\u2028+   downloads() %>% mutate(\u2028+     count = zoo::rollapply(count, 7, mean, fill = \"extend\"))\u2028+ })
Besides inlining values, unquoting has a second essential function: inlining meta-reactive objects as code
> downloads <- metaReactive({\u2028+   cranlogs::cran_downloads(!!input$package,\u2028+     from = Sys.Date() - 365, to = Sys.Date())\u2028+ })
> downloads_rolling <- metaReactive({\u2028+   downloads() %>% mutate(\u2028+     count = zoo::rollapply(count, 7, mean, fill = \"extend\"))\u2028+ })
